Description: Fragment of lip and neck of Clazomenian black-figure painted pottery slim amphora: Neck, siren, to right, with long hair tied behind, necklace, and wings back-to-back. Body, part of a purple tongue. Purple also on forepart of wing, on necking ring, and for stripe on the dark inside of the lip. The lip is grooved.
Producer name: Attributed to an Apprentice/Pupil of: The Petrie Painter
Curator's comments: Tanis ii, pl. 31. 5. BMC B.115.12. BSA xlvii, 128-B.8.
Findspot "Qasr" determined by Petrie 1888, pl. xxix
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B115.12)
CVA British Museum 8 / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain 13, British Museum 8 (Pl. GB 589, 1)
Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (pl. xxxi, 5)
Weber 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus anderen ägyptischen Fundorten (TD 118)
